page.title: 03Farming around Ballywalter
page.content: In our block there is a lot of grassland with half of the farmers keeping dairy cows and the other half keeping beef cattle. The dairy farmers cannot keep more than a certain amount of milk in a year.They send their milk to Belfast and other large towns.The farms are about fifty to one hundred acres in size. On some of the larger farms they grow winter barley,winter wheat,spring barley,spring wheat and oats. Farmers cut silage about May and then cut a second cut in July or August. Sheep are kept by a few farmers while others have pigs and poultry. Pigs and poultry can be kept by farmers who have very little land.
